attributes.action: Abolish the payouts to MPs who decide not to stand for re-election
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: MP's should not be entitled to an allowance following a decision not to seek re-election at the next general election. In many cases the will receive a very generous pension entitlement after only a few years service and this should not be supplemented by large gratuities which are not available to ordinary hard working taxpayers. Abolishing these allowances forthwith would be a declaration of intent to clean up the allowances system, and restore a bit of faith in Parliament.

rejection.details: It is Parliament who decides the pay for MPs. This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament: http://www.parliament.uk/
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
